content.question: A student wants to investigate how different values of capacitance affect the potential difference across capacitors in series. Which of the following circuits will allow the student to do this?

choices.label: The figure presents a rectangular circuit. The left side has a battery, the top side has a capacitor, the right side has a capacitor, and the bottom side has a voltmeter.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with a vertical branch in the middle, connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The left side has a battery, the top side to the left of the middle vertical branch has a capacitor, and the right side has a voltmeter. The middle vertical branch has a capacitor.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with two vertical branches in the middle, connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The left side of the circuit has a battery and the right side has a voltmeter. Both middle vertical branches each have a capacitor.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with a vertical branch in the middle, connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The left side of the circuit has a battery, the top side to the left of the middle vertical branch has a voltmeter, and the right side has a capacitor. The middle vertical branch has a capacitor.

content.answer: The figure presents a rectangular circuit with a vertical branch in the middle, connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle.
